attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2024-1213

Date: 2024-11-14

   The Committee of the Privy Council has had before it a report from the Right Honourable Justin P.J. Trudeau, the Prime Minister, stating that by Commission dated the 4th day of September, 2019, Brenda Louise Murphy, was appointed Lieutenant Governor of the Province of New Brunswick; and

 

   That the said Brenda Louise Murphy made and subscribed the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867 and assumed the duties of the said office on the 8th day of September, 2019.

 

   The Committee, therefore, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, advises that a Commission under the Great Seal of Canada do issue appointing Louise Imbeault of Moncton, in the Province of New Brunswick, to be Lieutenant Governor of the Province of New Brunswick, and that, from the date on which the said Louise Imbeault makes and subscribes the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867, the Commission issued hereunder shall supersede the Commission appointing Brenda Louise Murphy to be Lieutenant Governor of the said Province.

 


   Le très honorable Justin P.J. Trudeau, premier ministre, avait présenté au Comité du Conseil privé un rapport déclarant que Brenda Louise Murphy, était nommée lieutenante-gouverneure de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, en vertu d’une commission datée du 4 septembre 2019;

 

   Que ladite Brenda Louise Murphy, a prêté et souscrit les serments d’allégeance et d’office prévus à l’article 61 de la Loi constitutionnelle de 1867 et a assumé les fonctions de cette charge le 8 septembre 2019.

 

   À ces causes, sur recommandation du premier ministre, le Comité recommande qu’une commission sous le grand sceau du Canada soit émise nommant Louise Imbeault de Moncton (Nouveau-Brunswick), lieutenante-gouverneure de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, et ce, à compter de la date à laquelle ladite Louise Imbeault prêtera et souscrira les serments d’allégeance et d’office prévus à l’article 61 de la Loi constitutionnelle de 1867, la commission émise en vertu de la présente remplacera celle qui nommait l’honorable Brenda Louise Murphy, au poste de lieutenante-gouverneure de ladite province.

PC Number: 2024-1213Date: 2024-11-14

	 	 That the said Brenda Louise Murphy made and subscribed the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867 and assumed the duties of the said office on the 8th day of September, 2019.

 

	 	 The Committee, therefore, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, advises that a Commission under the Great Seal of Canada do issue appointing Louise Imbeault of Moncton, in the Province of New Brunswick, to be Lieutenant Governor of the Province of New Brunswick, and that, from the date on which the said Louise Imbeault makes and subscribes the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867, the Commission issued hereunder shall supersede the Commission appointing Brenda Louise Murphy to be Lieutenant Governor of the said Province.
